message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

This paper deals with the Shannon capacity, a concept from information theory, and uses methods from combinatorics and optimization to obtain lower bounds on the independence number of cycles. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory). However, the paper also involves combinatorial and computational aspects, which make cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity) likely sub-categories as well. The use of stochastic search methods suggests cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) as a possible sub-category, and the focus on graph theory and algorithms could also make cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) a relevant sub-category.
